alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 6:41AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Northeastern Brooks Range. This includes the cities of Anaktuvuk Pass, Atigun Pass, Galbraith Lake, Sagwon, And Franklin Bluffs. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy showers over the Northeastern Brooks Range Friday night through Saturday night dropped 2 to 3 inches of rain between Atigun Pass and Sagwon. This caused rapid rises on all rivers draining north from the Brooks Range. The Sagavanirtok River had minor flooding near Pump Station 3 on Sunday, but is now falling. This high water is now moving away from the mountains and is expected to reach the coast later today. Water levels are now falling near the mountains, and water levels will fall downstream late tonight. A flood warning is in effect today for all rivers from the Sagavanirtok River west. Rivers east of the Sagavanirtok River may be flooded as well. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People in the Northeast Brooks Range should be alert to the possibility of flooding along larger rivers further way from the mountains on today.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
